QuantumToys.jws

Class SchroedingerSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • QuantumToys.jws.SchroedingerSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class SchroedingerSolver
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener
    SchroedingerSolver implements the graphical interface for this Java Web application. It generates a window and draws all the controls. All calculations are done by SchroedingerCalculator. And sent to the JFreeChart as a dataset.
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Danilo Enoque Ferreira de Lima
    See Also:
    SchroedingerCalculator

      • itemStateChanged

        public void itemStateChanged(java.awt.event.ItemEvent e)
        Method called when a check box is selected.
        Specified by:
        itemStateChanged in interface java.awt.event.ItemListener
        Parameters:

      • getDatasetPsi

        public org.jfree.data.xy.XYDataset getDatasetPsi()
        Get the JFreeChart dataset with plots to be shown.
        Returns:
        An XYDataset with the $\psi$ and $|\psi^2|$ plots.

      • getDatasetEnergy

        public org.jfree.data.xy.XYDataset getDatasetEnergy()
        Get a flat plot with the energy value and the potential energy curve as a JFreeChart plot.
        Returns:
        A JFreeChart dataset with two plots: the energy and the potential energy.

      • updatePlot

        public void updatePlot()
        Update the plot, by getting the JFreeChart datasets from the SchroedingerCalculator. This will update the existing plot to the new one. It also adjusts the energy axis range and writes the new energy value as an annotation.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Method called when the "Update" button is clicked. It will read all text boxes and check boxes, update the SchroedingerCalculator parameters, and call recalculatePotential to update the internal potential array, and then try to calculate the wave function and energy. It calls updatePlot to redraw the results.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - (optional) Indicates which action happened.

      • load

        public void load()
        Method called when Java Web Start application is loaded. It makes the window and creates all graphical objects. It also creates a new instance of the SchroedingerCalculator class, used for the calculations.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main function, called when the application starts. Just creates an instance of the SchroedingerSolver class and calls load() to create all the graphical objects.
        Parameters:
        args - (optional) Command line arguments, if any.
